changes.summary: These are my changes since the last known version

datatypes.name: char
datatypes.description: Single character value, can include any alphanumeric character or punctuation except the delimiter. All char fields are case sensitive (i.e. m != M).

datatypes.name: Boolean
datatypes.description: Char field containing one of two values: 'Y' = True/Yes, 'N' = False/No

datatypes.name: int
datatypes.description: Sequence of digits without commas or decimals and optional sign character (ASCII characters '-'' and '0' - '9'). The sign character utilizes one byte (i.e. positive int is '99999' while negative int is '-99999'). Note that int values may contain leading zeros (e.g. '00023' = '23').

datatypes.name: String
datatypes.description: Alpha-numeric free format strings, can include any character or punctuation except the delimiter. All String fields are case sensitive (i.e. morstatt != Morstatt).

datatypes.name: UTCTimestamp
datatypes.description: String field representing Time/date combination represented in UTC (Universal Time Coordinated, also known as 'GMT') in either YYYYMMDD-HH:MM:SS (whole seconds) or YYYYMMDD-HH:MM:SS.sss (milliseconds) format, colons, dash, and period required.

datatypes.name: SeqNum
datatypes.description: Integer field representing a message sequence number. Value must be positive.

datatypes.name: NumInGroup
datatypes.description: Integer field representing the number of entries in a repeating group. Value must be positive.

fields.name: BodyLength
fields.description: The message length in bytes

fields.name: MsgType
fields.description: The message type code

fields.name: SenderCompID
fields.description: Used to identify the message sender.

fields.name: TargetCompID
fields.description: Used to identify the message recipient.

fields.name: MsgSeqNum
fields.description: The message sequence number

fields.name: PossDupFlag
fields.description: Populated for retransmitted messages

fields.name: PossResend
Populated when there is a chance that the message is a duplicate of a message sent under a different sequence number
SendingTime
fields.description: The time of message transmission, in UTC.

fields.name: CheckSum
fields.description: 3 byte checksum calculated in accordance with the FIX specification.

info.name: Symbology
info.description:
Customer should feel free to send any of the following symbol identifiers in field 55:

  • RIC
  • Exchange code
  • Bloomberg code

info.name: Market Hours
info.description:
Participants may connect to the system from 05:00 local time, and place orders from 06:00.

The market will open with an auction at 08:30, and close with an aution at 16:30 local time.

All connected sessions will be disconnected at 22:00 local time.

fields.name: Header
fields.description: Standard FIX header.

fields.name: TestReqID
fields.description: Must be populated when the heartbeat is a response to a TestRequest message.

fields.name: Footer
fields.description: Standard FIX footer.

fields.name: Header
fields.description: Standard FIX header.

fields.name: TestReqID
fields.description: Test request id. Any string can be used.

fields.name: Footer
fields.description: Standard FIX footer.

fields.name: Header
fields.description: Standard FIX header.

fields.name: BeginSeqNo
fields.description: Sequence number of the first message requested to be resent

fields.name: EndSeqNo
fields.description: Sequence number of the last message requested to be resent, or zero if all messages subsequent to BeginSeqNo are to be resent.

fields.name: Footer
fields.description: Standard FIX footer.

fields.name: Header
fields.description: Standard FIX header.

fields.name: RefSeqNum
fields.description: The sequence number of the rejected message

fields.name: RefTagID
fields.description: The tag number of the FIX field being referenced

fields.name: RefMsgType
fields.description: The type code for the message being referenced

fields.name: SessionRejectReason
fields.description: Code to identify the reason for a session level reject message, if appropriate

values.name: Non data value includes field delimiter (SOH character)
Incorrect NumInGroup count for repeating group
Repeating group fields out of order
Tag specified out of required order
Value is incorrect (out of range) for this tag
Tag not defined for this message type

fields.name: Text
fields.description: Message to explain the reason for rejection, where possible

fields.name: Footer
fields.description: Standard FIX footer.

fields.name: Header
fields.description: Standard FIX header.

fields.name: GapFillFlag
fields.description: Used to indicate that message is being used in gap-fill-mode

values.name: Gap Fill message, MsgSeqNum field valid

fields.name: NewSeqNo
fields.description: The new next message sequence number to be used.

fields.name: Footer
fields.description: Standard FIX footer.

session.name: Logout
session.description: Closing of a connection to the system is initiated by sending a Logout message to the other party. This should then be acknowledged by the other party by replying with a Logout message.Either the client or UBS may initiate disconnection.

fields.name: Header
fields.description: Standard FIX header.

fields.name: Text
fields.description: Will be populated in the event of venue disconnection to provide a reason for the disconnection.

fields.name: Footer
fields.description: Standard FIX footer.

session.name: Logon
session.description: The logon message authenticates a user establishing a connection to a remote system.

fields.name: Header
fields.description: Standard FIX header.

fields.name: HeartBtInt
fields.description: The heartbeat interval.

fields.name: ResetSeqNumFlag
fields.description: Indicates both sides of the FIX session should reset sequence numbers. Should only be specified when this message is sent to instruct a sequence number reset.

fields.name: Footer
fields.description: Standard FIX footer.

application.name: NewOrderSingle
application.description: The new order message used to submit the new order in given security(symbol)/

fields.name: Header
fields.description: Standard FIX header.

fields.name: ClOrdID
fields.description: Unique identifier of the order as assigned by the client

fields.name: NoPartyIDs
fields.description: The number of repeating groups to follow. The repeating groups should contain unique combinations of PartyID, PartyIDSource, and PartyRole.

fields.name: PartyID
fields.description: The party id (counterparty, trader etc.)

fields.name: PartyIDSource
fields.description: The type of party id.

fields.name: PartyRole
fields.description: The type of party:

values.name: Order Origination Trader (when trader id is given for field 448)
Order Origination Firm (when counterparty id is given for field 448)

fields.name: HandlInst
fields.description: Instructions for order handling

values.name: Automated execution order, private, no Broker intervention

fields.name: Symbol
fields.description: Common, 'human understood' representation of the security.

fields.name: Side
fields.description: Buy or sell side.

fields.name: TransactTime
fields.description: The time that this order request was initiated

fields.name: OrderQty
fields.description: The quantity of the order.

fields.name: Price
fields.description: Limit price, required for limit orders.

fields.name: TimeInForce
fields.description: The execution strategy to be used.

fields.name: Footer
fields.description: Standard FIX footer.

application.name: DontKnowTrade
application.description: The Don’t Know Trade (DK) message notifies a trading partner that an electronically received execution has been rejected. This message can be thought of as an execution reject message.

fields.name: Header
fields.description: Standard FIX header.

fields.name: OrderID
fields.description: The OrderID corresponding to the problem execution.

fields.name: ExecID
fields.description: The Execution ID of the problem execution.

fields.name: DKReason
fields.description: The reason code corresponding to the problem. (If appropriate; use Z=other if not).

fields.name: Symbol
fields.description: Order symbol. This should correspond to the execution report.

fields.name: Side
fields.description: Order side. This should correspond to the execution report.

fields.name: OrderQty
fields.description: This should correspond to the execution report.

fields.name: LastQty
fields.description: Required if specified on the execution report

fields.name: LastPx
fields.description: Required if specified on the execution report

fields.name: Text
fields.description: This should contain an error message indicating the nature of the problem.

fields.name: Footer
fields.description: Standard FIX footer.

application.name: ExecutionReport
application.description: Venue will send a series of Execution Report messages to the client to provide notification regarding order execution. Execution Report messages are used to indicate: order accepted, order partially filled, order filled, order cancelled, and order rejected.

fields.name: Header
fields.description: Standard FIX header.

fields.name: Ord QtyOrderID
fields.description: Unique identifier of the order as assigned by UBS.

fields.name: ClOrdID
fields.description: The identifier of the order as assigned by the client in the New Order – Single message.

fields.name: ExecID
fields.description: Unique identifier of the execution report, as assigned by UBS.

fields.name: ExecType
fields.description: Describes the purpose of the execution report.

fields.name: OrdStatus
fields.description: Describes the current status of the order

fields.name: OrdRejReason
fields.description: May be supplied when ExecType = 8 (Rejected), to indicate the reason for the rejection, if the reason corresponds to one of the standard codes for this field.

values.name: Duplicate of a verbally communicated order

fields.name: Symbol
fields.description: Order symbol. This will match the symbol specified in the order request.

fields.name: Side
fields.description: Specifies the side of the order. This will match the side specified in the order request.

fields.name: OrderQty
fields.description: The quantity, as specified in the order request

fields.name: OrdType
fields.description: The order type, as specified in the order request

fields.name: Price
fields.description: The price specified on the order request, if one was present

fields.name: TimeInForce
fields.description: The time in force value as specified on the order request.

fields.name: LastQty
fields.description: If ExecType(150) = Trade(F), then this will contain the quantity of the order fill being reported. Otherwise this field will contain zero.

fields.name: LastPx
fields.description: If ExecType(150) = Trade(F), then this will contain the rate at which the fill being reported was executed. Otherwise this field will not be specified.

fields.name: LeavesQty
fields.description: The quantity open for further execution.If OrdStatus(39) is Cancelled (4) or Rejected(8) then this will be zero. Otherwise it will take the value:OrderQty(38) – CumQty(14)

fields.name: CumQty
fields.description: The cumulative, currently executed quantity for the order.

fields.name: AvgPx
fields.description: The average price of all fills for this order.

fields.name: Text
fields.description: May be used to return an error message if the ExecType = 8 (Rejected) or 4 (Cancelled).

fields.name: Footer
fields.description: Standard FIX footer.

application.name: BusinessMessageReject
application.description: Used to reject an invalid Don’t Know Trade message.

fields.name: Header
fields.description: Standard FIX header.

fields.name: RefSeqNum
fields.description: The sequence number of the rejected message

fields.name: RefMsgType
fields.description: The type code for the message being rejected

fields.name: BusinessRejectRefID
fields.description: The 'business-level' ID field for the message being rejected. For a Don’t Know Trade message, this will be the ExecID field.

fields.name: BusinessRejectReason
fields.description: Code to identify the reason for the rejection.

values.name: DeliverTo firm not available at this time

fields.name: Text
fields.description: This will contain an error message indicating the nature of the problem.

fields.name: Footer
fields.description: Standard FIX footer.

workflows.name: Standard life of an order
workflows.description: The workflow modls the basic workflow of an order

states.name: New
states.description: Unacknowledged, new order sent to target recipient

states.name: Acknowledged
states.description: Initial acknowledgement of receipt of a new (unexecuted) order

states.name: Rejected
states.description: Rejection without execution of a new order

states.name: Partially Filled
states.description: An order which has been partially filled

states.name: Fully Filled
states.description: An order which has been fully filled (ie no further quantity to execute)

states.name: Closed
states.description: An order which is out of the market
